skill.name: statistical-analysis
skill.description: Statistical analysis toolkit. Hypothesis tests (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square), regression, correlation, Bayesian stats, power analysis, assumption checks, APA reporting, for academic research.
skill.summary: Statistical analysis toolkit. Hypothesis tests (t-test, ANOVA, chi-square), regression, correlation,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with a local Python utility. No network access, no file system access beyond temp plotting, no credential theft patterns, no malicious code execution. The assumption_checks.py script only operates on user-provided data in memory.

content.value_statement: Choosing statistical tests and reporting results correctly can be challenging. This skill guides test selection, assumption checking, effect sizes, power analysis, and APA-style reporting for academic research.
actual_capabilities: Guide test selection for group comparisons using decision trees
Check normality with Shapiro-Wilk tests and Q-Q plot visualizations
Check homogeneity of variance with Levene test and box plots
Detect outliers using IQR or z-score methods with visual highlights
Calculate effect sizes including Cohen d, eta-squared, and confidence intervals
Generate APA-style reporting templates for t-tests, ANOVA, regression, and Bayesian analyses
limitations: Does not execute full statistical analyses automatically
Requires Python libraries like numpy, pandas, scipy, and matplotlib
Does not handle data loading, cleaning, or storage
Bayes Factor calculation examples require additional packages

use_cases.title: Plan thesis analysis
use_cases.description: Choose appropriate tests, conduct power analysis, and plan assumption checks for study design.

use_cases.title: Validate model assumptions
use_cases.description: Run normality, variance, linearity, and outlier diagnostics before regression modeling.

use_cases.title: Write APA results
use_cases.description: Generate publication-ready statistical reports with effect sizes and assumption summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Pick a test
prompt_templates.prompt: I have two independent groups with a continuous outcome. The data look non-normal. Which test should I use and why?

prompt_templates.title: Check assumptions
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through assumption checks for a one-way ANOVA and suggest remedies if assumptions fail.

prompt_templates.title: Report results
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an APA style reporting template for a multiple regression with three predictors.

prompt_templates.title: Plan Bayesian analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a Bayesian t-test workflow including priors, diagnostics, and how to report results.

output_examples.input: Compare two groups and explain the assumptions I must check
output: Use independent samples t-test for normal data, or Mann-Whitney U for non-normal data
Check normality with Shapiro-Wilk test and Q-Q plot for each group
Check homogeneity of variance with Levene test
If violations occur, use Welch correction or non-parametric alternatives

best_practices: Check assumptions before interpreting results and report all diagnostic tests conducted
Always report effect sizes with confidence intervals alongside p-values
Conduct a priori power analysis to determine sample size before data collection
anti_patterns: Choosing tests based only on which yields significant p-values without checking assumptions
Reporting only significant results and omitting effect sizes and non-significant findings
Using post hoc power analysis as proof of study validity

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works as guidance in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limitations?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and example code, not automated data analysis or file operations.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my Python stack?
faq.answer: Yes, references scipy, statsmodels, pingouin, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, and pymc.

faq.question: Does it access or upload my data?
faq.answer: No, it contains local guidance and scripts without network or file system access.

faq.question: What if plots or tests fail?
faq.answer: Verify required libraries, data types, and check for missing values before rerunning.

faq.question: How does it compare to statistical software?
faq.answer: It guides selection and reporting but does not replace SPSS, R, or dedicated stats software.
